snippet: Once, a rape accuser might have found the word “whore” on a note in her locker and heard accusations about her behavior whispered behind her. Now, this is on social media — and the single good thing about that public ugliness is that it can no...
abstract: Once, a rape accuser might have found the word “whore” on a note in her locker and heard accusations about her behavior whispered behind her. Now, this is on social media — and the single good thing about that public ugliness is that it can no longer be ignored.

headline.main: Why We Should Thank Twitter's Rape Defenders
